column1: 133*{'text': 'Sextus Julius Severus
column3: is sent to Judea (from 136 renamed Syria Palaestina) to quell a revolt.'

column1: 132*{'text': "The Temple of Olympian Zeus (Athens) is completed using Cossutius' design."
132*{'text': 'The messianic
column2: charismatic Jewish leader Simon bar Kokhba starts a war of liberation for Judea (Bar Kokhba revolt) against the Romans
column3: which is eventually crushed (in 135) by emperor Hadrian.'

column1: 132*{'text': 'The legion X Fretensis must evacuate Jerusalem
132*{'text': 'Change of era name from Yongjian (7th year) to Yangjia of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
131*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian builds the city Aelia Capitolina on the location of Jerusalem.'
131*{'text': "The Praetor's Edict is definitively codifed by Salvius Julianus on Hadrian's orders."
131*{'text': 'Edict of Hadrian prohibiting the practice of circumcision.'
130*{'text': 'A law is passed in Rome banning the execution of slaves without a trial.'
130*{'text': 'The Temple of Olympian Zeus is completed at Athens.'
130*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian visits the cities Petra and Gerasa (Jerash).'
130*{'text': 'A Triumphal Arch for Hadrian is built in Gerasa.'
130*{'text': "Canopus
130*{'text': "The Hadrian's Gate in Antalya (Turkey) is constructed
130*{'text': 'Huviska becomes king of the Kushan Empire in India.'
130*{'text': 'The Scythian king Rudradaman I reconquers from the Andhra the lands annexed by Gautamiputra.'
130*{'text': 'Basra becomes the capital of Arabia.'
130*{'text': 'Claudius Ptolemaeus tabulates angles of refraction for several media.'
130*{'text': 'The Antinous Mondragone is sculpted.'
136*{'text': 'The war against the Suebi begins.'
136*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian chases the Jews from Galilee and receives a triumphal arch near Scythopolis.'
136*{'text': 'The Roman province of Iudaea (plus Galilee) becomes Syria Palaestina
column2: the first use of the name Palestine as a designation for Judea.'

column1: 136*{'text': 'First year of Yonghe era of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
136*{'text': 'Pope Hyginus succeeds Pope Telesphorus as the ninth pope.'
136*{'text': 'Change of Patriarch of Constantinople from Patriarch Eleutherius to Patriarch Felix.'
135*{'text': 'The Bar Kokhba revolt ends and
135*{'text': 'A Jewish diaspora begins as emperor Hadrian bars Jews from Jerusalem and has survivors of the massacre dispersed across the Roman Empire.'
135*{'text': 'Jerusalem is renamed Colonia Aelia Capitolina
135*{'text': 'An altar to Jupiter is erected on the site of the Temple in Jerusalem.'
135*{'text': "Canopus
135*{'text': 'Epictetus writes the Enchiridion (approximate date).'
134*{'text': 'A law improving the lot of free workers is passed in Rome.'
134*{'text': 'Arrianus
column3: repulses an attack of the Alani
column4: a nomadic tribe from southeastern Russia.'

column1: 134*{'text': 'Sextus Julius Severus
column3: begins in the summer a campaign against the Jewish rebel strongholds in the mountains.'

column1: 134*{'text': 'The Romans retake Jerusalem.'
134*{'text': 'A university of rhetoric
139*{'text': 'The Tomb of Hadrian in Rome is completed
column2: emperor Antoninus Pius cremates the body of Hadrian and placed his ashes together with that of his wife Vibia Sabina and his adopted son

column1: 139*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius is named Caesar.'
139*{'text': 'Antoninus Augustus Pius and Caius Bruttius Praesens become Roman Consuls.'
138*{'date': 'February 25'
column2: 'text': 'Emperor Hadrian makes Antoninus Pius his successor
column3: on condition that he adopts Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus.'

column1: 138*{'text': 'Antoninus Pius succeeds Hadrian as Roman Emperor and asks the Senate to confer divine honors for Hadrian.'
138*{'text': 'The silver content of the Roman denarius falls to 75 percent under emperor Antoninus Pius
column2: down from 87 percent under the reign of Hadrian.'

column1: 120*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian visits Britain.'
120*{'text': 'Foss Dyke is constructed in Britain.'
120*{'text': 'An Indian ambassadorial contingent visits with Hadrian.'
120*{'text': "Suetonius becomes Hadrian's secretary ab epistolis."
120*{'text': 'Change of era name from Yuanchu (7th year) to Yongning of the Chinese Eastern Han Dynasty.'
121*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian fixes the border between Roman Britain and Caledonia on a line running from the River Tyne to the Solway Firth.'
121*{'text': 'Era name changes from Yongning (2nd year) to Jianguang in the Chinese Eastern Han Dynasty.'
122*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian orders that a 73-mile (117-kilometer) wall be built to mark the northern Roman Empire.'
122*{'text': 'Vindolanda a Roman auxiliary fort (castrum) in northern England is garrisoned by cohort VIIII Batavorum.'
122*{'date': 'September 13'
122*{'text': 'Change of era name from Jianguang (2nd year) to Yanguang of the Chinese Eastern Han Dynasty.'
123*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian averts a war with Parthia by a personal meeting with Osroes I.'
123*{'text': 'Mug Nuadat defeats the High King of Ireland
123*{'text': 'The Chinese government establishes Aide of the Western Regions over the Tarim Basin.'
124*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian begins to rebuild the Olympeion in Athens.'
125*{'text': 'The Pantheon is constructed in (Rome) as it stands today by Hadrian.'
125*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian establishes the Panhellenion.'
125*{'text': 'Plague sweeps North Africa in the wake of a locust invasion that destroys large areas of cropland.'
125*{'text': 'Change of emperor of the Chinese Han Dynasty from Han Andi to Marquis of Beixiang
125*{'text': 'Gautamiputra Satakarni
column2: a king of the Andhra dynasty
column3: destroys the kingdom of Maharashtra near Bombay.'

column1: 125*{'text': 'Zhang Heng of Han Dynasty China invents a hydraulic-powered armillary sphere.'
125*{'text': 'The Satires of Juvenal intimate that bread and circuses (panem et circenses) keep the Roman people happy.'
125*{'text': 'Pope Telesphorus succeeds Pope Sixtus I as the eighth pope.'
126*{'text': 'First year of the Yongjian era of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
127*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian returns to Rome after a seven year voyage to the Roman provinces.'
127*{'text': 'Kanishka I starts to rule in Kushan Empire (approximate date).'
127*{'text': 'The philosopher Carpocrates rejects ownership of private property as being un-Christian.'
128*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian visits the Roman province of North Africa
column2: in order to inspect Legio III Augusta stationed at Lambaesis.'

column1: 128*{'text': 'The fossils of large prehistoric animals are discovered in Dalmatia.'
128*{'text': 'Pantheon
129*{'text': 'A defense for Numidia is constructed at Lambaesis by Legio III Augusta.'
129*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian continues his voyages
129*{'text': 'Change of Patriarch of Constantinople from Patriarch Diogenes to Eleutherius.'
199*{'text': 'Mesopotamia is partitioned into two Roman provinces divided by the Euphrates
199*{'text': 'Emperor Septimius Severus lays siege to the city-state Hatra in Central-Mesopotamia
column2: but fails to capture the city despite breaching the walls.'

column1: 199*{'text': 'Geodeung succeeds Suro as king of the Korean kingdom of Gaya (traditional date).'
199*{'text': 'Sun Ce and Zhou Yu wed the Qiao sisters.'
199*{'text': 'Pope Zephyrinus succeeds Pope Victor I as the fifteenth pope.'
198*{'text': 'Publius Septimius Geta
198*{'text': 'Caracalla
column3: is given the title of Augustus.'

column1: 198*{'text': 'Mark I succeeds Olympians as Patriarch of Constantinople.'
200*{'text': 'Human population reaches about 257 million.'
200*{'text': 'Emperor Septimus Severus visits Syria
200*{'text': 'Palestine
column2: benefiting from the benevolent policies of Severus

column1: 200*{'text': 'The province of Numidia is taken from the African proconsul and made an Imperial province.'
200*{'text': 'Rudrasena I
column2: Saka ruler of the Western Satrap dynasty
column3: becomes king of Malwa in ancient India.'

column1: 200*{'text': 'The Classic Age of Maya civilization begins (around this year).'
200*{'text': 'The Paracas culture in the Andes comes to an end (around this year).'
200*{'text': 'Septimius Severus
200*{'text': 'Clement of Alexandria denounces the use of musical instruments to support human voices in Christian music.'
200*{'text': 'Brahmanism evolves into Hinduism (approximate date).'
195*{'text': 'Emperor Septimius Severus has the Senate deify Commodus in an attempt to gain favor with the family of Marcus Aurelius.'
195*{'text': 'The province of Syria is divided and the role of Antioch is diminished.'
195*{'text': 'Lucius Septimius Bassianus (Caracalla)
column3: changed his name to Marcus Aurelius Antoninus to solidify connections with the family of Marcus Aurelius and is given the title Caesar.'

column1: 195*{'text': 'Clodius Albinus
column2: who had been proclaimed emperor in Britain
column3: crosses into Gaul with his legions
column4: while at the same time recruiting new soldiers.'

column1: 195*{'text': 'The denarius is devalued by Severus.'
194*{'text': 'Imperator Lucius Septimius Severus Pertinax Augustus and Decimus Clodius Septimius Albinus Caesar become Roman Consuls.'
194*{'text': 'Septimius Severus besieged Byzantium (194-196)
column2: the city walls suffers extensive damage.'

column1: 194*{'text': 'First year of Xingping era of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
194*{'text': 'Galen writes his manual on pathology
194*{'text': 'Irenaeus declares Gnostic doctrines to be heretical.'
197*{'text': "Septimius Severus returns to Rome and has about 30 of Albinus's supporters in the Senate executed."
197*{'text': 'Septimius Severus forms new naval units
column2: manning all the triremes in Italy with heavily armed troops for war in the East.'

column1: 197*{'text': 'Legio I
column3: and III Parthica are levied by Septimius Severus for his Parthian campaign.'

column1: 197*{'text': 'The Roman army marched east to repel a Parthian invasion of Mesopotamia
column2: they loot the royal palace at Ctesiphon and capture an enormous number of its inhabitants as slaves.'

column1: 197*{'text': 'Septimius Severus reconstitutes the Province of Mesopotamia under an equestrian governor commanding two legions.'
197*{'text': 'Septimius Severus
column2: who had spared the Senate at the beginning of his reign
column3: now excludes it from controlling the Roman empire by declaring a military dictatorship.'

column1: 197*{'text': "Galen's major work on medicines
197*{'text': 'A Christian council is held in Edessa.'
196*{'text': 'Emperor Septimius Severus captures and sacks Byzantium
column2: the city is rebuilt and regains its previous prosperity.'

column1: 196*{'text': 'First year of Jianan era of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
196*{'text': 'Emperor Xian of Han returns to Luoyang ravaged by war and seeks for protection of warlord Cao Cao.'
191*{'text': 'Dong Zhuo orders Lü Bu to excavate the tombs of the late Han Emperors with royal treasures.'
190*{'text': 'A part of Rome burns
column2: and Emperor Commodus orders the city to be rebuilt under the name Colonia Commodiana.'

column1: 190*{'text': 'A Roman road crosses the Alps by the Simplon Pass.'
190*{'text': 'First year of the Chuping era of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
190*{'text': 'The Campaign against Dong Zhuo begins.'
190*{'text': 'Luoyang is burned and plundered by the forces of Dong Zhuo.'
190*{'text': 'Cleomedes teaches that the moon does not glow on its own
190*{'text': 'Egypt (under Roman rule) is impoverished due to an inflation rate of 100% during the previous decade.'
190*{'text': 'The percentage of silver in the Egyptian denarius is lowered from 90% to 70%.'
193*{'text': 'Pertinax is forced to reorganize the handling of finances
column3: and to reestablish discipline in the Roman army.'

column1: 193*{'text': 'Pertinax suspend the food programs established by Trajan
column2: this provokes the ire of the Praetorians.'

column1: 193*{'date': 'March 28'
column2: 'text': 'Pertinax is assassinated by members of the Praetorian Guard

column1: 193*{'date': 'April 9'
column2: 'text': 'Lucius Septimius Severus is proclaimed Emperor by his troops in Illyricum (Balkans).'

column1: 193*{'text': 'The Roman governors Clodius Albinus (Britannia) and Pescennius Niger (Syria) claim with support of their troops the imperial throne.'
193*{'date': 'June 1'
column2: 'text': 'Septimius Severus enters the capital and has Julianus put to death.'

column1: 193*{'text': 'Septimius Severus finally gains control of the Roman Empire
column2: in Britain Clodius Albinus allies with him and accepted the title of Caesar.'

column1: 193*{'text': 'Septimius Severus defeats the army under Pescennius at the Battle of Cyzicus and Battle of Nicaea (Asia Minor).'
193*{'text': 'The silver content of the Roman denarius falls to 50 percent under emperor Septimius Severus
column2: down from 68 percent under Marcus Aurelius.'

column1: 192*{'date': 'December 31'
column2: 'text': 'Emperor Commodus alarms the Senate by appearing dressed as a gladiator for his new consulship (January 1).'

column1: 192*{'text': 'Civil war again strikes Rome (192–193).'
192*{'text': 'The kingdom of Champa begins to control south and central Vietnam (approximate date).'
192*{'text': 'Lü Bu murders his stepfather Dong Zhuo
192*{'text': "A fire destroys Galen's library."
115*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan is cut off in southern Mesopotamia after his invasion of that region.'
115*{'text': 'Trajan captures the Parthian capital of Ctesiphon.'
115*{'text': 'Alexandria in Egypt is destroyed during the Jewish-Greek civil wars.'
115*{'text': 'A revolt breaks out in Britain; the garrison at Eboracum (York) is massacred.'
115*{'text': 'The Pantheon of Agrippa is reconstructed in Rome.'
115*{'text': "Lusius Quietus
column3: begins a brutal campaign to maintain the peace in the region."

column1: 115*{'text': 'An earthquake destroys Apamea and Antioch in Syria.'
115*{'text': 'Pope Sixtus I succeeds Pope Alexander I as the seventh pope according to Catholic biographies.'
114*{'text': 'The Arch of Trajan is erected in Benevento.'
114*{'text': 'The kingdom of Osroene becomes a vassal kingdom of the Roman Empire.'
114*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan defeats the Parthians and overruns Armenia and northern Mesopotamia.'
114*{'text': 'A monument to Philopappos
column2: prince-in-exile of old Commagene (a buffer-state between Rome and Parthia) is erected in Athens.'

column1: 114*{'text': 'First year of Yuanchu era of the Chinese Eastern Han Dynasty.'
114*{'text': 'Change of Patriarch of Constantinople from Patriarch Sedecion to Patriarch Diogenes.'
117*{'text': 'Trajan subdues a Jewish revolt (the Kitos War)
column3: leaving Hadrian in command of the east.'

column1: 117*{'date': 'August 9'
column2: 'text': 'Emperor Trajan dies of a stroke at Selinus in Cilicia
column4: while en route from Mesopotamia to Italy.'

column1: 117*{'text': 'The silver content of the Roman denarius falls to 87 percent under emperor Hadrian
column2: down from 93 percent in the reign of Trajan.'

column1: 117*{'text': 'John I becomes the 7th Bishop of Jerusalem.'
116*{'text': "Emperor Trajan completes his invasion of Parthia by capturing the cities of Seleucia
column4: marking the high-water mark of the Roman Empire's eastern expansion."

column1: 116*{'text': 'Trajan makes Syria a province of Rome and crosses the Tigris to annex Adiabene.'
116*{'text': 'Trajan removes Osroes I as king of Parthia
column2: and appoints his son Parthamaspates in his place.'

column1: 116*{'text': 'Trajan sends two expeditionary forces.'
116*{'text': 'Trajan sends laureatae to the Roman Senate on account of his victories and being conqueror of Parthia.'
116*{'text': 'Quintus Marcius Turbo sailes to Alexandria and defeates the Jews in several pitched battles.'
111*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan sends Pliny the Younger as governor (legatus Augusti) to Bithynia.'
111*{'text': 'The Indian Emperor Cenguttuvan invades the Kushan Empire and defeats Kanishka and his brother Vijaya at Quilaluvam (near Mathura).'
110*{'text': 'The Roman Empire has more than 75
110*{'text': 'The Forum of Trajan is constructed in Rome by the Syrian architect Apollodorus of Damascus.'
110*{'text': 'Tacitus is named proconsul of the province of Asia (110–113).'
110*{'text': 'Suetonius publishes Of illustrious men (De viris illustribus).'
113*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan sails from Rome to begin his expedition against Parthia.'
113*{'text': "Trajan builds Trajan's Column near the Colosseum in Rome to commemorate his victory over the Dacians in the Second Dacian War."
113*{'text': 'Trajan declares Armenia to be annexed and becomes a Roman province.'
113*{'text': 'Basilica Ulpia is dedicated.'
112*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan and Titus Sextius Africanus become Roman Consul.'
112*{'text': 'Publius Cornelius Tacitus is Governor of the Roman province of Asia
112*{'text': 'Salonina Matidia receives the title of Augusta.'
119*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian stations Legio VI Victrix in Roman Britain
column2: to assist in quelling the resistance of a local rebellion.'

column1: 119*{'text': 'Salonina Matidia
column3: Hadrian delivers her a funeral oration and granted her a temple in Rome.'

column1: 119*{'text': 'Reign in Northern India by Nahapana
118*{'text': 'The Roman Forum commissioned by the late Emperor Trajan is completed with triumphal arches
column4: and an enormous basilica that all of which replace hundreds of dwellings.'

column1: 118*{'text': 'Emperor Hadrian is also a Roman Consul.'
118*{'text': 'Rome has a population exceeding 1 million
column2: making it the largest city in the world.'

column1: 118*{'text': 'Osroene is returned to native rule by the Roman Empire.'
118*{'text': 'Pantheon
column3: is started to be built (approximate date).'

column1: 118*{'text': 'The north-south feud between the Hun dynasty ends.'
118*{'text': 'The oldest known painted depiction of a wheelbarrow is found in a Chinese tomb of Chengde
108*{'text': 'Appius Annius Trebonius Gallus and Marcus Appius Bradua become Roman Consul.'
108*{'text': 'Tacitus writes Histories
column2: which covers the period from 69 to 96.'

column1: 109*{'text': 'The Baths of Trajan built by the architect Apollodorus of Damascus are dedicated during the Kalends.'
109*{'date': 'June 24'
column2: 'text': 'The Aqua Traiana is inaugurated by emperor Trajan
column3: the aqueduct channels water from Lake Bracciano

column1: 109*{'text': 'Pliny the Younger is legate to Bithynia.'
109*{'text': 'The Christian Church proclaims itself to be universal (catholic).'
102*{'text': 'Lucius Julius Ursus Servianus and Lucius Licinius Sura become Roman Consul.'
102*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan returns to Rome after a successful campaign against Dacia
column2: through which he reestablishes clear Roman sovereignty over king Decebalus.'

column1: 102*{'text': 'Trajan divides Pannonia into two provinces sometime between this year and 107.'
102*{'text': 'The port of Portus is enlarged.'
102*{'text': 'The presence of sugar in the urine is interpreted as a sign of illness in India.'
103*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan and Manius Laberius Maximus become Roman Consul.'
103*{'text': 'Pliny the Younger becomes a member of the college of Augurs (103–104).'
103*{'text': 'Legio X Gemina moves to Vienna
column2: where it remains until the 5th century.'

column1: 101*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan starts an expedition against Dacia
column2: exceeding the limits of the Roman Empire set by Augustus.'

column1: 101*{'text': 'The Second Battle of Tapae is fought.'
101*{'text': 'Epictetus writes and publishes The Discourses.'
101*{'text': 'The Tibetans introduce their Buddhist Religion into Indonesia.'
101*{'text': 'Plutarch writes his Parallel Lives of Famous Men (in Greek Βίοι Παράλληλοι) containing fifty biographies
column2: of which 46 are presented as pairs comparing Greek and Roman celebrities—for example Theseus and Romulus
column3: Alexander the Great and Julius Caesar

column1: 106*{'text': 'Ignatius writes a letter to Christians in Smyrna (around this year) where the term Catholic Church is used.'
106*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan conquers the Dacian Fortresses of the Orăştie Mountains and surrounds the capital
106*{'text': 'Trajan annexes Nabataean Arabia (with its capital Petra) as a Roman province.'
106*{'text': 'Change of Han Hedi to Han Shangdi of the Chinese Eastern Han Dynasty.'
106*{'text': 'Change of Han Shangdi to Han Andi of the Chinese Eastern Han Dynasty.'
107*{'text': 'Lucius Licinius Sura and Quintus Sosius Senecio become Roman Consul.'
107*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan divides Pannonia into two portions sometime between 102 and this year.'
107*{'text': 'An Indian ambassador is received by Trajan.'
107*{'text': 'First year of yongchu era of the Chinese Eastern Han Dynasty.'
107*{'text': 'Han Andi (An-ti
column5: giving power to Empress Deng Sui.'

column1: 107*{'text': 'Bagan (in present-day Burma) is founded by Thamudarit.'
104*{'text': 'Pliny the Younger is a member of the college of Augurs (103–104).'
104*{'text': 'Nijmegen is renamed Ulpia Noviomagus Batavorum.'
104*{'text': 'A fire breaks out in Rome.'
104*{'text': 'Trajan gives the order to have the Alcántara Bridge built over the Tagus River at Alcántara (Hispania)
104*{'text': 'Apollodorus of Damascus builds a stone bridge over the Danube more than 1
column4: almost 20 meters high (65 ft) and 15 meters wide (49 ft).'

column1: 105*{'text': 'Emperor Trajan starts the second expedition against Dacia
column2: he leaves with the Imperial Roman fleet from Brundusium.'

column1: 105*{'text': 'Legio XXX Ulpia Victrix and II Traiana Fortis are created by Trajan.'
105*{'text': 'The Romans conquer Kerak from the Nabateans.'
105*{'text': 'Pacorus II of Parthia dies after a 27-year reign in which he has reclaimed all of his empire.'
105*{'text': "Emperor He Di dies after a 17-year reign in which court eunuchs and the emperor's in-laws have regained influence."
105*{'text': 'A peace treaty is signed between Baekje and Silla in the Korean peninsula (the war started in 85).'
105*{'text': 'The Trajan Bridge is finished.'
105*{'text': 'Change of Patriarch of Constantinople from Patriarch Plutarch to Patriarch Sedecion.'
179*{'text': 'The Roman fort Castra Regina ("fortress by the Regen river") is built at Regensburg
column2: on the right bank of the Danube in Germany.'

column1: 179*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius drives the Marcomanni over the Danube and reinforces the border.'
179*{'text': 'Gogukcheon succeeds his father Shindae as King of Goguryeo.'
178*{'text': 'Bruttia Crispina marries Commodus and receive the title of Augusta.'
178*{'text': 'Emperor Marcus Aurelius and his son Commodus arrive at Carnuntum in Pannonia
column2: and travel to the Danube to fight against the Marcomanni.'

column1: 178*{'text': 'The Montanist heresy is condemned for the first time.'
177*{'text': 'Lucius Aurelius Commodus Caesar (age 15) and Marcus Peducaeus Plautius Quintillus become Roman Consuls.'
177*{'text': 'Commodus is given the title Augustus and is made co-emperor with the same status as his father Marcus Aurelius.'
177*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius begins a systematic persecution of Christians at Rome
column2: the followers take refuge in the catacombs.'

column1: 176*{'date': 'November 27'
column2: 'text': 'Marcus Aurelius grants Commodus the rank of Imperator and makes him Supreme Commander of the Roman legions.'

column1: 176*{'date': 'December 23'
column2: 'text': 'Emperor Marcus Aurelius and his son Commodus enter Rome after a campaign north of the Alps and receive a triumph for their victories over the Germanic tribes.'

column1: 175*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius suppresses a revolt of Avidius Cassius
column3: after the latter proclaims himself emperor.'

column1: 175*{'text': 'Avidius Cassius fails in seeking support for his rebellion and is assassinated by Roman officers.'
175*{'text': 'Commodus
column2: son of Marcus Aurelius and his wife Faustina

column1: 175*{'text': 'M. Sattonius Iucundus
column3: restores the Thermae of Coriovallum (modern Heerlen ) there are sources that state this happened in the 3rd century.'

column1: 175*{'text': 'Pope Eleuterus succeeds Pope Soter as the thirteenth pope (approximate date).'
174*{'text': 'Reign in India of Yajnashri Satakarni
173*{'text': 'Gnaeus Claudius Severus and Tiberius Claudius Pompeianus become Roman Consuls.'
173*{'date': 'June 11'
column2: 'text': 'Emperor Marcus Aurelius begins a campaign against the Quadi
column3: who had broken the peace treaty (171).'

column1: 172*{'text': 'Emperor Marcus Aurelius crosses the Danube with an expeditionary force
column2: he subdue the Marcomanni and their allies.'

column1: 172*{'text': 'The Sarmatians attack the lower Danube frontier.'
172*{'text': 'Avidius Cassius
column3: suppresses an agrarian revolt in Egypte and is made supreme commander of the Roman army in the East.'

column1: 172*{'text': 'Montanism spreads through the Roman Empire.'
171*{'text': 'Emperor Marcus Aurelius forms a new military command
171*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius signs a peace treaty with the Quadi and the Sarmatian Iazyges.'
171*{'text': 'Armenia and Mesopotamia becomes a protectorate of the Roman Empire.'
171*{'text': 'The Costoboci cross the Danube (Dacia) and ravage Thrace in the Balkan Peninsula.'
170*{'text': 'The Suebian tribes of the Marcomanni cross the Danube and invade northern Italy.'
170*{'text': 'The Marcomanni plunder Opitergium (modern Oderzo) and besiege Aquileia.'
170*{'text': 'Emperor Marcus Aurelius writes in Sirmium (Pannonia) his first of 12 books of the Meditations in Koine Greek.'
170*{'text': 'The Costoboci cross the Danube (Dacia) and ravage Thrace in the Balkan Peninsula.'
170*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius orders humane treatment for Christians and slaves throughout the Roman Empire.'
170*{'text': 'An Equestrian Statue of Marcus Aurelius is erected in Rome.'
170*{'text': 'The fundamental works of Ptolemy on cartography are published.'
182*{'text': 'Marcus Petronius Sura Mamertinus and Quintus Tineius Rufus become Roman Consuls.'
182*{'text': 'Emperor Commodus escapes death at the hands of assassins
column2: who have attacked him at the instigation of his sister Lucilla and a large group of senators.'

column1: 183*{'text': 'An assassination attempt on Roman Emperor Commodus by members of the Senate fails.'
180*{'text': 'The Quadi are chased westwards
180*{'date': 'March 17'
column2: 'text': "Emperor Marcus Aurelius dies after a week's illness at his camp in Vindobona (modern Vienna)."

column1: 180*{'text': 'The Era of the Five Good Emperors ends.'
180*{'text': 'Rome creates a 4-mile wide buffer zone by the Danube.'
180*{'text': 'Work begins in Rome on the building of the Column of Marcus Aurelius.'
180*{'text': 'Porta Nigra is built in Germanian Trier.'
180*{'text': 'The Goths reach the banks of the Black Sea.'
180*{'text': 'This year is often suggested as the first year of the Three Kingdoms period of China.'
180*{'text': 'Lake Taupo erupts
column2: forming ash clouds as far as China and Europe.'

column1: 180*{'text': "Galen's popular work on hygiene is published."
180*{'date': 'July 17'
column2: 'text': 'Twelve Christian inhabitants of Scillium in Numidia are executed in Carthage (also in North Africa) (known as the Scillitan Martyrs) – they had refused to swear an oath to the Emperor.'

column1: 180*{'text': 'Commodus creates an official cult of the Zoroastrian god Mithra.'
181*{'text': 'Imperator Lucius Aurelius Commodus and Lucius Antistius Burrus become Roman Consuls.'
181*{'text': 'The Antonine Wall is overrun in Britannia.'
181*{'text': 'The volcano associated with Lake Taupo in New Zealand erupts
column2: one of the largest on Earth in the last 5

column1: 186*{'text': 'The Hatepe volcanic eruption extends Lake Taupo and makes skies red across the world.'
187*{'text': 'Lucius Septimius Severus
187*{'text': 'Septimius Severus marries a Syrian princess Julia Domna (age 17)
column2: she is the youngest daughter of high-priest Julius Bassianus
column3: a descendant of the Royal House of Emesa.'

column1: 187*{'text': 'Another plague hits Rome.'
187*{'text': 'Clodius Albinus defeats the Chatti
column2: a highly organized German tribe that controlled the area that includes the Black Forest.'

column1: 184*{'text': 'The Antonine Wall in Britannia is permanently abandoned.'
184*{'text': 'The Yellow Turban Rebellion and Liang Province Rebellion break out in China.'
184*{'text': 'Zhang Jue leads the peasant revolt against Emperor Ling of the Han Dynasty.'
184*{'date': 'June'
column4: in command of the imperial army and sends Liu Bei to defeat the rebel forces in Runan.'

column1: 184*{'date': 'Winter'
column2: 'text': 'The stronghold Wan city is besieged and captured.'

column1: 184*{'text': 'Beolhyu of Silla ascends the throne.'
185*{'text': 'Publius Helvius Pertinax quells the mutiny of the British Roman legions.'
185*{'text': 'Tigidius Perennis
column2: his family and many others are executed for conspiring against Commodus.'

column1: 185*{'text': "Emperor Commodus drains Rome's treasury to put on gladiatorial spectacles and confiscates property to support his pleasures."
185*{'text': 'Reign in India of Vasudeva
185*{'text': 'Zhi Yao
column2: a Kushan Buddhist monk of Yuezhi ethnicity
column3: translates Buddhist texts into the Chinese language during the Han Dynasty.'

column1: 185*{'date': 'February'
column2: 'text': 'The rebels of the Yellow Turban are defeated by the imperial army

column1: 185*{'text': "Cleomedes discovers the refraction of light by the Earth's atmosphere."
185*{'text': 'A supernova now known as SN 185 is noted by Chinese astronomers in the Astrological Annals of the Houhanshu
column2: making it the earliest recorded supernova.'

column1: 185*{'text': 'Irenaeus writes that there are only four Gospels (approximate date).'
188*{'text': 'Publius Helvius Pertinax becomes proconsul of Africa.'
188*{'text': 'Queen Himiko (aka
column2: Pimiko) is said to have begun her reign in Japan.'

column1: 188*{'text': 'Zhang Ju and Zhang Chun are defeated by Han forces under Liu Yu.'
189*{'text': 'Plague (possibly smallpox) kills as many as 2
189*{'text': 'The Prince of Hongnong succeeds Emperor Ling as Chinese emperor of the Han Dynasty.'
189*{'text': 'Dong Zhuo has the Prince of Hongnong deposed and installs Emperor Xian as emperor.'
189*{'text': 'Galen publishes his "Treatise on the various temperaments" (aka On the Elements According to Hippocrates).'
189*{'text': 'Pope Victor I succeeds Pope Eleuterus as the fourteenth pope
189*{'text': 'Demetrius of Alexandria becomes Patriarch of Alexandria.'
189*{'text': 'Pantaenus
column2: who was sent by the bishop of Alexandria to India to preach Christianity

column1: 168*{'text': 'Emperor Marcus Aurelius and his stepbrother Lucius Verus leave Rome
column2: and establish their headquarters at Aquileia.'

column1: 168*{'text': 'The Roman army crosses the Alps into Pannonia and subdue the Marcomanni at Carnuntum north of the Danube.'
168*{'text': 'Change of Han Huandi to Han Lingdi of Han Dynasty; first year of Jianning era.'
169*{'text': 'Northern African Moors invade what is now Spain.'
169*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius becomes sole Roman Emperor upon the death of Lucius Verus.'
169*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius forced his daughter Lucilla into marriage with Claudius Pompeianus.'
169*{'text': 'Galen moves back to Rome for good.'
169*{'text': 'Pertinax succeeds Alypius as Patriarch of Constantinople.'
169*{'text': 'Theophilus of Antioch becomes Patriarch of Antioch.'
164*{'text': "The governor of Syria
column4: crosses the Euphrates and invades Parthian territory."

column1: 164*{'text': 'Ctesiphon is captured by the Romans
column2: but returned to the Parthians after the end of the war.'

column1: 164*{'text': 'The Antonine Wall in Scotland is abandoned by the Romans.'
164*{'text': 'A law is passed protecting property brought into a marriage by the wife.'
164*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius gives his daughter Lucilla in marriage to his co-emperor Lucius Verus.'
164*{'text': 'Seleucia on the Tigris is destroyed.'
165*{'text': 'A Roman military operation under Avidius Cassius is successful against Parthia
165*{'text': 'A pandemic known as the Antonine Plague breaks out in Rome after the Roman army returns from Parthia.'
165*{'text': 'Legio II Italica is levied by emperor Marcus Aurelius.'
165*{'text': 'The Romans establish a garrison at Doura Europos on the Euphrates
column2: a control point for the commercial route to the Persian Gulf.'

column1: 165*{'text': 'Avidius Cassius takes Nisibis and conquers the north of Mesopotamia.'
165*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius creates four legal districts (iuridici) in Italy (5 if Rome is included).'
165*{'text': 'The philosopher Justin of Nablus is executed in Rome as a Christian.'
165*{'text': 'Discourse to the Greek (Oratio ad Graecos)
column3: is the first treatise on the evils of paganism in Christian literature.'

column1: 166*{'text': 'Dacia is invaded by barbarians.'
166*{'text': 'Conflict erupts on the Danube frontier between Rome and the Germanic tribe of the Marcomanni.'
166*{'text': 'Emperor Marcus Aurelius appoints his sons as Caesars
column2: while he and Lucius Verus travel to Germany.'

column1: 166*{'text': 'A plague (possibly small pox)
column2: comes from the East and spreads throughout the Roman Empire

column1: 166*{'text': 'The Lombards invade Pannonia (modern Hungary).'
166*{'text': 'A Roman envoy arrives by sea in Rinan commandery in southern China (central Vietnam).'
166*{'text': 'Pope Soter succeeds Pope Anicetus as the twelfth pope.'
167*{'text': 'Imperator Lucius Aurelius Verus Augustus and Marcus Ummidius Quadratus Annianus become Roman Consuls.'
167*{'text': 'The Marcomanni tribe wages war against the Romans at Aquileia.'
167*{'text': 'The Vandals (Astingi and Lacringi) and the Sarmatian Iazyges invade Dacia.'
167*{'text': 'The Germans devastate the Balkans and ransack the sanctuary of Eleusis
167*{'text': 'Change of era name from Yanxi to Yongkang of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
160*{'text': 'The first Buddhist monks arrive in China.'
161*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius
column2: a Spaniard like Trajan and Hadrian
column5: and an energetic man of action.'

column1: 161*{'text': 'The weight of a goldpiece
column3: is reduced from 7.81 grams under Aurelius to 7.12 grams.'

column1: 161*{'text': "Gaius' Institutiones are published."
161*{'text': 'The silver content of the Roman denarius falls to 68 percent under emperor Marcus Aurelius
column2: down from 75 percent under Antoninus Pius.'

column1: 162*{'text': 'Lucius Verus begins a war with the Parthians
column2: due to the invasion of Syria and Armenia by Vologases IV of Parthia.'

column1: 163*{'text': 'Statius Priscus reconquers Armenia; Artaxata is ruined.'
151*{'text': 'Mytilene and Smyrna are destroyed by an earthquake.'

151*{'text': 'Detail from a rubbing of a stone relief in Wu family shrine (Wuliangci)

150*{'text': 'The Germans of the east move south
column2: into the Carpathians and Black Sea area.'

column1: 150*{'text': 'The Albani appear in the Roman province of Macedon.'
150*{'text': 'First and only year of Heping of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
150*{'text': 'The Middle Culture period of Mayan civilization ends (approximate date).'
150*{'text': 'The Great Pyramid of the Sun is constructed in Teotihuacan.'
150*{'text': "The earliest atlas (Ptolemy's Geography) is made (approximate date)."
150*{'text': "This is also the approximate date of completion of Ptolemy's monumental work Almagest."
150*{'text': 'Antoninus Liberalis writes a work on mythology (Μεταμορφωσεων Συναγωγη) (approximate date).'
153*{'text': 'Minor uprisings occur in Egypt against Roman rule.'
153*{'text': 'Change of era name from Yuanjia (3rd year) to Yongxing of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
152*{'text': 'Minor uprisings occur in Mauritania against Roman rule.'
152*{'text': 'The Chinese domination of the Tarim Basin weakens.'
155*{'text': 'Emperor Antoninus Pius starts a new war against the Parthians who are led by Vologases IV.'
155*{'text': 'Rome states that while it will not be recognized as an official religion
155*{'text': "The Romans begin to abandon Hadrian's Wall."
155*{'text': 'First year of Yongshou era of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
155*{'text': 'Pope Anicetus succeeds Pope Pius I as the eleventh pope.'
155*{'text': 'The Christian bishops are in disagreement regarding the date of Easter.'
154*{'text': 'The king of Bosphorus
column3: pays tribute to Rome due to the threat posed by the Alani.'

column1: 154*{'text': 'Anicetus becomes pope (approximate date).'
154*{'text': 'Anicetus meets with Polycarp of Smyrna to discuss the Computus
column2: the date of Easter in the Christian calendar.'

column1: 154*{'text': 'Change of Patriarch of Constantinople from Patriarch Euzois to Patriarch Laurence.'
157*{'text': 'La Mojarra Stela 1 in Mesoamerica is produced.'
156*{'text': 'The heresiarch Montanus first appears in Ardaban (Mysia).'
158*{'text': 'The earliest dated use of Sol invictus

146*{'text': 'Faustina the Younger is given the title Augusta and becomes Roman Empress.'
146*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius receives the imperium proconsular.'
146*{'text': 'Change of era name from Yongxi (1st year) to Benchu era of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
146*{'text': 'Change of emperor from Han Zhidi to Han Huandi of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
147*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius receives imperial powers from the Roman Emperor Antoninus Pius.'
147*{'text': 'First year of Jianhe of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
144*{'text': 'Lucius Hedius Rufus Lollianus Avitus and Titus Statilius Maximus become Roman Consuls.'
144*{'text': 'The Roman campaigns in Mauretania begin.'
144*{'text': 'Change of era name from Hanan (3rd year) to Jiankang era of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'

144*{'text': 'Reign of Kanishka
144*{'text': 'Change of Patriarch of Constantinople from Patriarch Polycarpus II to Patriarch Athendodorus.'
145*{'text': 'Antoninus Augustus Pius and Marcus Aurelius Caesar become Roman Consuls.'
145*{'text': 'Marcus Aurelius marries Faustina the Younger

145*{'text': 'Change of emperor from Han Chongdi to Han Zhidi of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
142*{'text': 'Emperor Antoninus Pius orders the construction of the Antonine Wall.'
142*{'text': 'Municipal doctors are named throughout the Roman Empire.'
142*{'text': 'First year of the Hanan era of the Chinese Han Dynasty.'
142*{'text': 'The Chinese Taoist alchemist Wei Boyang
column2: author of the Kinship of the Three
column3: is the first to describe an early form of gunpowder solution.'

column1: 143*{'text': 'Antoninus Pius as Roman Consul.'

143*{'text': 'The Roman doctor Antyllus performs the first arteriotomy.'
140*{'text': 'Emperor Antoninus Augustus Pius and Marcus Aurelius Caesar become Roman Consuls.'

column2: who becomes an ally of Rome.'

column1: 140*{'text': 'The export of olive oil from Hispania Baetica to Rome peaks.'
140*{'text': 'Pope Pius I succeeds Pope Hyginus as the tenth pope.'
140*{'text': 'Ptolemy completes his Almagest (approximate date).'
141*{'text': 'The Temple of Antoninus and Faustina is constructed in Rome
column2: the temple is dedicated to Faustina the Elder.'

column1: 141*{'text': 'Change of Patriarch of Constantinople from Patriarch Felix to Patriarch Polycarpus II.'
148*{'text': 'An Shih Kao arrives in China.'
148*{'text': 'Change of Patriarch of Constantinople from Patriarch Athendodorus to Patriarch Euzois.'
